sentence: Looking at the universe of stocks we cover at Dividend Channel , on 4/19/18, Procter & Gamble Company (Symbol: PG), Ford Motor Co. (Symbol: F), and Colgate-Palmolive Co. (Symbol: CL) will all trade ex-dividend for their respective upcoming dividends.

Procter & Gamble Company will pay its quarterly dividend of $0.7172 on 5/15/18, Ford Motor Co. will pay its quarterly dividend of $0.15 on 6/1/18, and Colgate-Palmolive Co. will pay its quarterly dividend of $0.42 on 5/15/18.

As a percentage of PG's recent stock price of $78.56, this dividend works out to approximately 0.91%, so look for shares of Procter & Gamble Company to trade 0.91% lower - all else being equal - when PG shares open for trading on 4/19/18.
Similarly, investors should look for F to open 1.31% lower in price and for CL to open 0.58% lower, all else being equal.
Below are dividend history charts for PG, F, and CL, showing historical dividends prior to the most recent ones declared.
In general, dividends are not always predictable, following the ups and downs of company profits over time.
Therefore, a good first due diligence step in forming an expectation of annual yield going forward, is looking at the history above, for a sense of stability over time.
This can help in judging whether the most recent dividends from these companies are likely to continue.
If they do continue, the current estimated yields on annualized basis would be 3.65% for Procter & Gamble Company , 5.24% for Ford Motor Co. , and 2.33% for Colgate-Palmolive Co..
In Tuesday trading, Procter & Gamble Company shares are currently off about 0.1%, Ford Motor Co. shares are up about 0.5%, and Colgate-Palmolive Co. shares are down about 0.5% on the day.
